channel.title: Debian on Made By Nathan
channel.description: Recent content in Debian on Made By Nathan

item.title: Can you plug a SATA drive into a SAS controller?
item.description: Yes. SATA and SAS use very similar connectors, but a SATA connector has a gap in the middle. This means that you can physically plug a SATA drive into a SAS connector, but you can’t plug a SAS drive into a SATA controller (because it won’t fit.) SAS controller software can support SATA drives, but SATA controllers don’t support SAS drives (even if you have an adapter.) Why do I have a SAS controller?
